Defendant, Person arrested and/or charged with a criminal offense but not yet convicted.
District Attorney, Person responsible for representing the State of Texas in an adversarial judicial proceeding

Local Selection Committee, Committee appointed by the Presiding Judge of the Administrative Judicial Region to adopt standards for the qualification of attorneys to be appointed to represent indigent defendants in capital cases in which the death penalty is sought.
Magistrate, Person responsible for informing the Defendant of their right to an appointed counsel and determination of indigent status.

The Clarus system shall be able to receive roadway weather measurements derived from VII data.
The Clarus system shall minimize the time for data acquisition.
The Clarus system shall process data as they are received.
The Clarus system shall collect pavement-related observations.
The Clarus system shall accept environmental data from emergency vehicles.
The Clarus system shall provide notification of data quality conditions to data collectors.
The Clarus system shall be able to disseminate data based on spatial queries.
The Clarus system data definitions shall be consistent with the ITE TM 1.03 standard, Functional Level Traffic Management Data Dictionary (TMDD).
The Clarus system shall acquire, process, and disseminate atmospheric metadata.
The Clarus system shall acquire, process, and disseminate surface metadata.
The Clarus system shall accept only observations of known measurement types and units.
The Clarus system shall accept data through a Clarus standard interface.
The Clarus system shall enable environmental data queries by location reference.
The Clarus system shall allow users to create a data subscription request.
The Clarus system shall disseminate data in response to polling.
The Clarus system shall be able to notify subscribers when data sets become available.
The Clarus system shall disseminate data using standard Internet protocols.
The Clarus system shall be able to collect data from sources within 5 minutes of them becoming available.
The Clarus system shall be able to publish new data within twenty minutes of data receipt.
The Clarus system shall be able to support six thousand registered users.
The Clarus program shall provide an environment that has uninterruptible power for the Clarus system.
The Clarus program shall provide network management tools.
The Clarus program standards shall accommodate contributions of new sensor technologies to the Clarus system.

The system shall be capable of updating preservation action costs based on expert elicitations.

ETCS shall be able to supervise train and shunting movements.
ETCS is required to be functional to a maximum train speed of 500 km/h.
The ETCS on-board shall be capable of receiving National values from the trackside to adapt to National requirements.
The DUAP System shall collect probe vehicle data.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect roadway traffic data from the MITS Center using the MITS traffic data interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect roadway traffic data from the Western Michigan Traffic Management System (WMTMS) using the WMTMS interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect road condition data from Traffic Management Systems (TMS) using the TMS interface.
The DUAP System shall be able to collect work zone (lane closure) data.
The DUAP System shall cache data only if the data record associates the data with its source, a georeferenced location, and a timestamp.
The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish roadway traffic information in Traffic Management Data Dictionary (TMDD) format.
The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish traffic data in the SimTraffic traffic analysis tool SimTraffic interface format.
The DUAP System shall be capable of adding new output formats of published data.
The DUAP System shall be capable of adding new presentations of published data.

The System shall provide the capability to control the execution of Scientific Algorithms.
The System shall be capable of rendering Mercator projections.
The System shall be capable of producing time-averaged Data Products.
The System shall be capable of generating NOAA-Unique and Tailored Data Products with Government-specified grid spacing.

Mediator generates service requirements as the basis for negotiated relationships.
Service Registry: Registers available local resources at the CDN provider and updates them.
The interaction protocol between Web Server - Service Registry, Service Registry - mediator is defined.
The mediator instance obtains resource and access information from the Service Registry and policy information from Policy Repository to establish negotiation.
Service requirements are received from the mediator.

Request is redirected to an optimal peer’s Web server.

Administrator: A member of the Construction Junction staff who can perform any of the Inventory Management functions.
Director: A member of the Construction Junction staff who can perform the same Inventory Management functions as a Manager, plus view, create, modify and delete Inventory Management users.

Customer Service Representative: A member of the Construction Junction staff who works in the customer service desk and performs specific tasks such as constituent and member database management, item returns processing, creating drop-off acquisitions, and others.
Decon Associate: A member of the Construction Junction staff who executes a deconstruction and/or strip out job and brings the items for processing at the receiving dock.

The ELSS must capture all data necessary for recording the fishing activities undertaken by a UK fishing vessel.
The ELSS must output the data as an XML file for transmission to the UK fisheries administrations’ ERS system.
The ELSS data must be validated against the UK XML/XSD before transmission from the fishing vessel.
The ELSS must provide the ability to print out the ELSS logbook data (including landing declarations) using an onboard printer.
The ELSS must permit the Master of the vessel to generate formatted data for transmission to the UK fisheries administrations’ ERS system.
The ELSS must provide facilities to capture and deliver for transmission corrections to previously successfully transmitted data.
The ELSS must only permit deletion messages to be generated and sent for reports sent during a current trip up to the End of Fishing report for that voyage.

A DigitalHome system shall use wireless signals to communicate, through the master control unit, with the humidistats.
